title: Welcome!
text:
I am Saranzaya Magsarjav, but you can call me Saka, currently undertaking a Ph.D. in maths at the Univeristy of Adelaide. My research area is quite broad from analysing drugs in waste water to quantifying civil disobidience to sentiment contagion. For my Ph.D. project I am looking into reproducibility and stability in topic modelling.
You can check out my professional activities here and my publications, or check out my blog where I write about anything that takes my fancy, usually something to do with maths.

title: Publications
text:
References

Pond, T., Magsarjav, S., South, T., Mitchell, L., Bagrow, J.P., 2020. Complex contagion features without social reinforcement in a model of social information flow. Entropy 22. https://doi.org/10.3390/e22030265


Bade, R., Tscharke, B.J., O’Brien, J.W., Magsarjav, S., Humphries, M., Ghetia, M., Thomas, K.V., Mueller, J.F., White, J.M., Gerber, C., 2021. Impact of COVID-19 controls on the use of illicit drugs and alcohol in australia. Environmental Science & Technology Letters 8, 799–804. https://doi.org/10.1021/acs.estlett.1c00532


Thomas, E.F., Leggett, N., Kernot, D., Mitchell, L., Magsarjav, S., Weber, N., 2022. Reclaim the beach: How offline events shape online interactions and networks amongst those who support and oppose right-wing protest. Studies in Conflict & Terrorism 0, 1–23. https://doi.org/10.1080/1057610X.2022.2034222
